intro: Pisonia anisophylla, commonly known as the silky pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a silvery or hairy appearance. Pisonia anisophylla thrives in coastal and tropical environments, often found in sandy soils near the shoreline.
